title: The Roman Emperor Augustus is named Pontifex Maximus, incorporating the position into that of the emperor.
text: The Roman Emperor Augustus is named Pontifex Maximus, incorporating the position into that of the emperor.

title: The Farewell Sermon (Khutbah, Khutbatul Wada') of the Islamic prophet Muhammad.
text: The Farewell Sermon (Khutbah, Khutbatul Wada') of the Islamic prophet Muhammad.

title: Execution of the 42 Martyrs of Amorium at Samarra.
text: Execution of the 42 Martyrs of Amorium at Samarra.

title: Byzantine conquest of Chandax by Nikephoros Phokas, end of the Emirate of Crete.
text: Byzantine conquest of Chandax by Nikephoros Phokas, end of the Emirate of Crete.

title: The Siege of Château Gaillard ends in a French victory over King John of England, who loses control of Normandy to King Philip II Augustus.
text: The Siege of Château Gaillard ends in a French victory over King John of England, who loses control of Normandy to King Philip II Augustus.

title: Treaty of Paris of 1323 is signed.
text: Treaty of Paris of 1323 is signed.

title: Thirteen Years' War: Delegates of the Prussian Confederation pledge allegiance to King Casimir IV of Poland who agrees to commit his forces in aiding the Confederation's struggle for independence from the Teutonic Knights.
text: Thirteen Years' War: Delegates of the Prussian Confederation pledge allegiance to King Casimir IV of Poland who agrees to commit his forces in aiding the Confederation's struggle for independence from the Teutonic Knights.

title: Ferdinand Magellan arrives at Guam.
text: Ferdinand Magellan arrives at Guam.

title: The first joint Secretary of the Royal Society, Henry Oldenburg, publishes the first issue of Philosophical Transactions of the Royal Society, the world's longest-running scientific journal.
text: The first joint Secretary of the Royal Society, Henry Oldenburg, publishes the first issue of Philosophical Transactions of the Royal Society, the world's longest-running scientific journal.

title: The First Fleet arrives at Norfolk Island in order to found a convict settlement.
text: The First Fleet arrives at Norfolk Island in order to found a convict settlement.

title: The Missouri Compromise is signed into law by President James Monroe. The compromise allows Missouri to enter the Union as a slave state, brings Maine into the Union as a free state, and makes the rest of the northern part of the Louisiana Purchase territory slavery-free.
text: The Missouri Compromise is signed into law by President James Monroe. The compromise allows Missouri to enter the Union as a slave state, brings Maine into the Union as a free state, and makes the rest of the northern part of the Louisiana Purchase territory slavery-free.

title: York, Upper Canada, is incorporated as Toronto.
text: York, Upper Canada, is incorporated as Toronto.

title: Texas Revolution: Battle of the Alamo – After a thirteen-day siege by an army of 3,000 Mexican troops, the 187 Texas volunteers, including frontiersman Davy Crockett and colonel Jim Bowie, defending the Alamo are killed and the fort is captured.
text: Texas Revolution: Battle of the Alamo – After a thirteen-day siege by an army of 3,000 Mexican troops, the 187 Texas volunteers, including frontiersman Davy Crockett and colonel Jim Bowie, defending the Alamo are killed and the fort is captured.

title: The Supreme Court of the United States rules in the Dred Scott v. Sandford case.
text: The Supreme Court of the United States rules in the Dred Scott v. Sandford case.

title: Dmitri Mendeleev presents the first periodic table to the Russian Chemical Society.
text: Dmitri Mendeleev presents the first periodic table to the Russian Chemical Society.

title: The Serbian kingdom is re-founded.
text: The Serbian kingdom is re-founded.

title: Bayer registers "Aspirin" as a trademark.
text: Bayer registers "Aspirin" as a trademark.

title: Real Madrid C.F. is founded.
text: Real Madrid C.F. is founded.

title: Italo-Turkish War: Italian forces become the first to use airships in war, as two dirigibles drop bombs on Turkish troops encamped at Janzur, from an altitude of 6,000 feet.
text: Italo-Turkish War: Italian forces become the first to use airships in war, as two dirigibles drop bombs on Turkish troops encamped at Janzur, from an altitude of 6,000 feet.

title: Portuguese Communist Party is founded as the Portuguese Section of the Communist International.
text: Portuguese Communist Party is founded as the Portuguese Section of the Communist International.

title: International Unemployment Day demonstrations globally initiated by the Comintern
text: International Unemployment Day demonstrations globally initiated by the Comintern

title: Norman Rockwell published Freedom from Want in The Saturday Evening Post with a matching essay by Carlos Bulosan as part of the Four Freedoms series.
text: Norman Rockwell published Freedom from Want in The Saturday Evening Post with a matching essay by Carlos Bulosan as part of the Four Freedoms series.

title: World War II: Cologne is captured by American troops.
text: World War II: Cologne is captured by American troops.

title: World War II: Operation Spring Awakening, the last major German offensive of the war, begins.
text: World War II: Operation Spring Awakening, the last major German offensive of the war, begins.

title: Ho Chi Minh signs an agreement with France which recognizes Vietnam as an autonomous state in the Indochinese Federation and the French Union.
text: Ho Chi Minh signs an agreement with France which recognizes Vietnam as an autonomous state in the Indochinese Federation and the French Union.

title: Cold War: The trial of Ethel and Julius Rosenberg begins.
text: Cold War: The trial of Ethel and Julius Rosenberg begins.

title: Georgy Malenkov succeeds Joseph Stalin as Premier of the Soviet Union and First Secretary of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union.
text: Georgy Malenkov succeeds Joseph Stalin as Premier of the Soviet Union and First Secretary of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union.

title: Ghana becomes the first Sub-Saharan country to gain independence from the British.
text: Ghana becomes the first Sub-Saharan country to gain independence from the British.

title: Nation of Islam leader Elijah Muhammad officially gives boxing champion Cassius Clay the name Muhammad Ali.
text: Nation of Islam leader Elijah Muhammad officially gives boxing champion Cassius Clay the name Muhammad Ali.

title: Constantine II becomes King of Greece.
text: Constantine II becomes King of Greece.

title: Premier Tom Playford of South Australia loses power after 27 years in office.
text: Premier Tom Playford of South Australia loses power after 27 years in office.

title: Cold War: Joseph Stalin's daughter Svetlana Alliluyeva defects to the United States.
text: Cold War: Joseph Stalin's daughter Svetlana Alliluyeva defects to the United States.

title: Three rebels are executed by Rhodesia, the first executions since UDI, prompting international condemnation.
text: Three rebels are executed by Rhodesia, the first executions since UDI, prompting international condemnation.

title: An explosion at the Weather Underground safe house in Greenwich Village kills three.
text: An explosion at the Weather Underground safe house in Greenwich Village kills three.

title: For the first time the Zapruder film of the assassination of John F. Kennedy is shown in motion to a national TV audience by Robert J. Groden and Dick Gregory.
text: For the first time the Zapruder film of the assassination of John F. Kennedy is shown in motion to a national TV audience by Robert J. Groden and Dick Gregory.

title: Algiers Accord: Iran and Iraq announce a settlement of their border dispute.

title: The first United States Football League games are played.
text: The first United States Football League games are played.

title: In the United Kingdom, a walkout at Cortonwood Colliery in Brampton Bierlow signals the start of a strike that lasted almost a year and involved the majority [but never all] of the country's miners.
text: In the United Kingdom, a walkout at Cortonwood Colliery in Brampton Bierlow signals the start of a strike that lasted almost a year and involved the majority [but never all] of the country's miners.

title: The British ferry MS Herald of Free Enterprise capsizes in about 90 seconds, killing 193.
text: The British ferry MS Herald of Free Enterprise capsizes in about 90 seconds, killing 193.

title: Three Provisional Irish Republican Army volunteers are shot dead by the SAS in Gibraltar in Operation Flavius.

title: A suicide bomber kills 68 people (including first responders) in Baghdad on the same day that a gunman kills eight students in Jerusalem.
